elements.title: George Kunkel
elements.contents: ... that actor George Kunkel (pictured) portrayed in blackface the character of Uncle Tom, using it at first to promote slavery during the American Civil War but later to attack it, after his views had changed?

elements.title: members of a Russian spiritual sect in Armenia
elements.contents: ... that sauerkraut made by members of a Russian spiritual sect in Armenia was popular in many other parts of the Soviet Union?

elements.title: The Blue Angels
elements.contents: ... that The Blue Angels was shot using IMAX cameras rigged to a helicopter, plus an ultra-high-speed camera shooting at 1,000 frames per second?

elements.title: Margaret Carroux
elements.contents: ... that Margaret Carroux's German translation of The Lord of the Rings contains errors introduced by her editor?

elements.title: LACE satellite
elements.contents: ... that the LACE satellite tracked rocket plumes from space for the United States's Star Wars program?

elements.title: Melanie L. Campbell
elements.contents: ... that Melanie L. Campbell was arrested for civil disobedience while protesting proposed restrictions on voting rights?

elements.title: Umbilicaria torrefacta
elements.contents: ... that historically, lichens like Umbilicaria torrefacta have been used to naturally dye traditional Scottish tartans and textiles?

elements.title: Edwin Ford Piper
elements.contents: ... that American poet Edwin Ford Piper preserved 828 folk songs, most of which were from Iowa and Nebraska?

elements.title: Golden Girls
elements.contents: ... that before reading the script for the play Golden Girls, at least nine of the cast members were under the impression that they would be taking the lead role?
